issue.title: Add TrueHD encoding
issue.body:
(This is the replacement for my accidentally deleted #5408)

I'm working on this for a long time now and did already multiple tests. This will add TrueHD encoding support to MKV and MP4. FFmpeg has fixed a lot of TrueHD encoding related issues in the past, and the quality is really good now in my tests. Sadly FFmpeg does also not support 7.1 audio for TrueHD, so it defaults to 5.1 as the best mixdown.
The benefit is, TrueHD would be the first 24-bit encoder for MP4.

There is one issues with this PR I don't know how to fix:
- Any mix downs to mono do have no sound.

This PR will benefit from FFmpeg 6.1 because of a lot of improvements from Paul B Mahol, therefore I would wait finishing this until HandBrake is on FFmpeg 6.1.


```
Encoder truehd [TrueHD]:
    General capabilities: dr1 delay small exp 
    Threading capabilities: none
    Supported sample rates: 44100 48000 88200 96000 176400 192000
    Supported sample formats: s16p s32p
    Supported channel layouts: mono stereo 2.1 3.0 5.0(side) 5.1(side)
mlpenc AVOptions:
  -max_interval      <int>        E...A...... Max number of frames between each new header (from 8 to 128) (default 16)
  -lpc_coeff_precision <int>        E...A...... LPC coefficient precision (from 0 to 15) (default 15)
  -lpc_type          <int>        E...A...... LPC algorithm (from 2 to 3) (default levinson)
     levinson        2            E...A......
     cholesky        3            E...A......
  -lpc_passes        <int>        E...A...... Number of passes to use for Cholesky factorization during LPC analysis (from 1 to INT_MAX) (default 2)
  -codebook_search   <int>        E...A...... Max number of codebook searches (from 1 to 100) (default 3)
  -prediction_order  <int>        E...A...... Search method for selecting prediction order (from 0 to 4) (default estimation)
     estimation      0            E...A......
     search          4            E...A......
  -rematrix_precision <int>        E...A...... Rematrix coefficient precision (from 0 to 14) (default 1)
```

**Tested on:**

- [ ] Windows 10+  (via MinGW)
- [X] macOS 10.13+
- [ ] Ubuntu Linux

comment.body: Only available in latest ffmpeg binary. Added also 3.1/4.0/4.1 layouts.

issue.title: Add TrueHD encoding
issue.body:
(This is the replacement for my accidentally deleted #5408)

I'm working on this for a long time now and did already multiple tests. This will add TrueHD encoding support to MKV and MP4. FFmpeg has fixed a lot of TrueHD encoding related issues in the past, and the quality is really good now in my tests. Sadly FFmpeg does also not support 7.1 audio for TrueHD, so it defaults to 5.1 as the best mixdown.
The benefit is, TrueHD would be the first 24-bit encoder for MP4.

There is one issues with this PR I don't know how to fix:
- Any mix downs to mono do have no sound.

This PR will benefit from FFmpeg 6.1 because of a lot of improvements from Paul B Mahol, therefore I would wait finishing this until HandBrake is on FFmpeg 6.1.


```
Encoder truehd [TrueHD]:
    General capabilities: dr1 delay small exp 
    Threading capabilities: none
    Supported sample rates: 44100 48000 88200 96000 176400 192000
    Supported sample formats: s16p s32p
    Supported channel layouts: mono stereo 2.1 3.0 5.0(side) 5.1(side)
mlpenc AVOptions:
  -max_interval      <int>        E...A...... Max number of frames between each new header (from 8 to 128) (default 16)
  -lpc_coeff_precision <int>        E...A...... LPC coefficient precision (from 0 to 15) (default 15)
  -lpc_type          <int>        E...A...... LPC algorithm (from 2 to 3) (default levinson)
     levinson        2            E...A......
     cholesky        3            E...A......
  -lpc_passes        <int>        E...A...... Number of passes to use for Cholesky factorization during LPC analysis (from 1 to INT_MAX) (default 2)
  -codebook_search   <int>        E...A...... Max number of codebook searches (from 1 to 100) (default 3)
  -prediction_order  <int>        E...A...... Search method for selecting prediction order (from 0 to 4) (default estimation)
     estimation      0            E...A......
     search          4            E...A......
  -rematrix_precision <int>        E...A...... Rematrix coefficient precision (from 0 to 14) (default 1)
```

**Tested on:**

- [ ] Windows 10+  (via MinGW)
- [X] macOS 10.13+
- [ ] Ubuntu Linux

comment.body: Awesome! Is this already in Nightly to test?

issue.title: VideoToolbox Encoder Hangs on Mac OS Sonoma
issue.body:
### Problem Description

After upgrading to Mac OS 14 Sonoma, h265 VideoToolBox encoder hangs.

**Steps to reproduce the problem (If Applicable):**

Using Mac Studio with 20 core M1 Ultra

Use Handbrake or HandbrakeCLI to encode H265 10-bit with Video Toolbox. First pass works. When it starts the second pass it gets stuck at:

Pass 2 of 2, 0.03%

Activity Monitor shows VTEncoderXPCService at 100%

While the GUI Handbrake doesn't crash, when using the CLI the GUI will stop responding and the computer will reboot itself after a few minutes.

This was working on Mac OS 13 Ventura before the upgrade to Sonoma.

HandbrakeCLI options are:

HandBrakeCLI --preset Apple 2160p60 4K HEVC Surround --auto-anamorphic --markers --previews 30:1 -a 1,1 -E ca_aac,ca_aac --mixdown 5point1,stereo --audio-fallback ca_aac -e vt_h265_10bit --quality 36 --title 1 --subtitle scan --subtitle-forced --subtitle-burned --native-language eng --detelecine --decomb --input Red_Dawn_1984_UHD.mkv --output Review/Red_Dawn_1984_UHD.m4v

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed. 

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster (I've attached all logs for the 4 different scenarios I described below). My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. And when I do use NVENC for rendering in Davinci I usually get *easily* triple figures.

I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

CPU: Ryzen 12-core 5900x
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3060Ti

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

comment.body:
NVDEC in HandBrake has got a lot of limitations, currently it's enabled only when there are no filters and frame rate is set to "same as source (variable)". You can check if it's being used in the activity log, instead of 

+ decoder: vp9 10-bit (yuv420p10le)

there should be something like

+ decoder: vp9 10-bit hwaccel (p010le, cuda)

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed. 

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster (I've attached all logs for the 4 different scenarios I described below). My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. And when I do use NVENC for rendering in Davinci I usually get *easily* triple figures.

I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

CPU: Ryzen 12-core 5900x
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3060Ti

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

comment.body: Just double-checked, NVDEC was already enabled, yeah. Just to make sure I disabled it to see the difference there was a rendering drop and my PC was not having fun rendering a moving window anymore so at least I know that's working!

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed. 

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster (I've attached all logs for the 4 different scenarios I described below). My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. And when I do use NVENC for rendering in Davinci I usually get *easily* triple figures.

I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

CPU: Ryzen 12-core 5900x
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3060Ti

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

comment.body: The bitrate of the source is quite high (48260 kbps) maybe the VP9 decoder is the bottleneck. I don't know if nvidia hardware VP9 decoder is enabled or not in the snapshot. Try to enabled NVDEC in the preferences/settings and see if something changes.

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed. 

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster (I've attached all logs for the 4 different scenarios I described below). My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

comment.body:
Great suggestion! Just tried the same settings with "Nightly 20231018071745-43c78c3d5-master (2023102301)" and it _**is**_ actually faster! Rendering at about 80fps now, with GPU and CPU utilisation hovering around 80-90% in task manager which is looking about right.

Strangely though, rendering at 1080p, once again, doesn't change rendering speed. Still about 80fps! GPU utilisation has dropped to 50-60% and CPU is still at 80-90%.

issue.title: Under Mac, Make HandbrakeCLI is able to display a progress bar on the output file icon like a GUI
issue.body: ### Description of the feature or enhancement you'd like to see in HandBrake GUI programs can show a progress while outputting a file, which is very convenient, but the compressed output from the command line does not have this. ### What Operating System are you running? Mac 14.0 ### What version of HandBrake are you running? 1.6.1 ### Where did you download HandBrake from? github ### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details _No response_

comment.body: The progress code is currently implemented in the macOS GUI, if someone wants to move it to libhb, patches are welcomed ;)

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed. 

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster (I've attached all logs for the 4 different scenarios I described below). My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. And when I do use NVENC for rendering in Davinci I usually get *easily* triple figures.

I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

CPU: Ryzen 12-core 5900x
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3060Ti

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

Mac 14.0 ### What version of HandBrake are you running? 1.6.1 ### Where did you download HandBrake from? github ### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details _No response_

comment.body:
The command line outputs a lot of data. Progress through the file is constantly updated, as the percentage of how far it is through the file. The display of progress is updated as new things to log are encountered, like updating that a section of the file has changed.

How do you propose displaying a "progress bar"?

issue.title: GPU encoding stuck at ~50fps regardless of settings?
issue.body:
### Problem Description

Hi everyone, I've been scratching my head over this problem. I record gameplay for my Youtube reviews which involves lots of 4k WEBM files from the PS5 and then I convert them into MP4s (because Davinci Resolve doesn't play well with WEBM files).

No matter what quality setting I use however, it will always only render the file at a speed of 50fps, regardless of if I use Slowest, Medium, or Fastest setting it won't change the rendering speed.

Strangely as well, the file size between Slowest and Medium are exactly the same (like Handbrake isn't even paying attention to my settings?) while Fastest is a little bit larger as you might expect.

I even tried with one render at 1080p at it only rendered about 10fps faster! My first thought is that it's some sort of bottleneck but I've turned off all filters, ignored audio conversion, and moved the source and output files to faster SSDs and it's made no effect to the rednering speed. And when I do use NVENC for rendering in Davinci  I usually get *easily* triple figures.

I hope I can gain some insight here. I posted on the subreddit and all I got was a condescending reply ignoring all my details. Is anyone familiar with this behaviour?

CPU: Ryzen 12-core 5900x
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3060Ti

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

issue.title: Under Mac, Make HandbrakeCLI is able to display a progress bar on the output file icon like a GUI
issue.body:
### Description of the feature or enhancement you'd like to see in HandBrake

GUI programs can show a progress while outputting a file, which is very convenient, but the compressed output from the command line does not have this.  


### What Operating System are you running?

Mac 14.0

### What version of HandBrake are you running?

1.6.1

### Where did you download HandBrake from?

github

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

_No response_

issue.title: VideoToolbox Encoder Hangs on Mac OS Sonoma
issue.body:
### Problem Description

After upgrading to Mac OS 14 Sonoma, h265 VideoToolBox encoder hangs.

**Steps to reproduce the problem (If Applicable):**

Using Mac Studio with 20 core M1 Ultra

Use Handbrake or HandbrakeCLI to encode H265 10-bit with Video Toolbox. First pass works. When it starts the second pass it gets stuck at:

Pass 2 of 2, 0.03%

Activity Monitor shows VTEncoderXPCService at 100%

While the GUI Handbrake doesn't crash, when using the CLI the GUI will stop responding and the computer will reboot itself after a few minutes.

This was working on Mac OS 13 Ventura before the upgrade to Sonoma.

HandbrakeCLI options are:

HandBrakeCLI --preset Apple 2160p60 4K HEVC Surround --auto-anamorphic --markers --previews 30:1 -a 1,1 -E ca_aac,ca_aac --mixdown 5point1,stereo --audio-fallback ca_aac -e vt_h265_10bit --quality 36 --title 1 --subtitle scan --subtitle-forced --subtitle-burned --native-language eng --detelecine --decomb --input Red_Dawn_1984_UHD.mkv --output Review/Red_Dawn_1984_UHD.m4v


### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

comment.body: I installed macOS 14.1 (23B74) and tried it again. Still hanging/crashing.

issue.title: Support for "setpts" and "atempo" arguments in the More Settings field.
issue.body:
### Description of the feature or enhancement you'd like to see in HandBrake

In the Video tab, there is a section called More Settings that accepts text arguments. If HandBrake does use FFmpeg under the hood why not allow the users to use these arguments to speed up video and audio for its transcoded output? This is the only feature I feel sad to not have in HandBreak or at least I was not able to find an equivalent arguments to place there that gives me a output sped up playback.

### What Operating System are you running?

PopOS 22.04

### What version of HandBrake are you running?

1.6.1

### Where did you download HandBrake from?

flatpak

### Activity Log, Crash Log or any other details

_No response_

comment.body: That's not how it works. HandBrake is not a user interface over FFmpeg cli. The more settings textfield is only for encoder options.
